A little bit of Mazzy Star, Mos Def, M83, Muse.... wait a minute... Milk.... bands that start with the letter M... hmmmm... curious.  I'm just realizing this as I write this.  Ha ha.  I should have called them on that!  Anywho... it was a nice mix of genres on the playlist they had goin' on in the little joint.  It's a comfortable little nook with some hipster feel to their decor.  I was diggin it.  It was clean and comfy.  Oh, you can check out pics of the place on their website.As for the food... my little crew and I decided to break up the inevitable tapas fest and threw in some western fare for dinner.  We all ended up getting burgers.  And they did not disappoint!  I had the BB deluxe... i think it was called.  The burger was a bit dry, but the sauteed onions totally made up for it.  And with the Spanish ketchup being just a bit different than what I'm used to... a little sweeter... it made for a great Spanish take on an American classic!  Good music, good food, good friends... all made for a great meal!Oh almost forgot.  The menu has both Spanish and English so it was very easy to peruse the menu.  And the really friendly waiter also spoke perfect English... and I must say... sounded a lot like Johnny Depp!.
